member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.BusinessLogic.ReportsBusinessLogic.GetResource(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a resource part of a document in multi-stream document format.
member.param: The client session ID which contains the document
The report instance used for the document
The ID of the document
The ID of the requested resource
member.remarks: The obsolete implementation of this method included a synchronous execution of Response.Body.Write() method. This approach is discouraged in .NET Core 3.0+, because it required to explicitly allow synchronous I/O operations in IISServerOptions during application startup. The newly introduced method GetResourceAsync follows the recommended approach of using asynchronous writing to the response body. For more information see the corresponding KB article.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ClientReportSource
member.summary: Represents a report source sent from a client to the . This class encapsulates the information required to identify and parameterize a report for processing or rendering.
member.remarks: Used as a data transfer object (DTO) for report requests from web or service clients. Supports only and types.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ClientReportSource.Report
member.summary: Gets or sets the string representation of a report document reference.
member.remarks: This property should contain either the type name (for ) or a URI/path (for ). Other report source types are not supported and will result in errors.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ClientReportSource.ParameterValues
member.summary: Gets or sets a dictionary of parameter name-value pairs to be passed to the reporting engine.
member.remarks: The keys are parameter names as defined in the report definition. The values are the corresponding parameter values.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.CreateDocumentArgs
member.summary: Represents the arguments required to create a report document using the method.
member.remarks: This class is used as a data transfer object (DTO) for specifying rendering options, device settings, and caching behavior when generating a report document. It is typically sent from the client to the server in a web API scenario.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.CreateDocumentArgs.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering format of the created document (e.g., PDF, XLSX, HTML5).
member.remarks: See the full list of built-in formats in the help article: Rendering Extensions

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.CreateDocumentArgs.DeviceInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets device-specific settings for the specified rendering format.
member.remarks: Device settings control rendering options such as page size, DPI, and other format-specific features. More info on device settings can be found in the help chapter: Device Information Settings

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.CreateDocumentArgs.UseCache
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the document should be returned from cached resources if available.
member.remarks: If set to true, the server will attempt to use a cached version of the document to improve performance.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.CreateDocumentArgs.BaseDocumentID
member.summary: Gets or sets the base document ID from the cache to be used as an interactivity blueprint.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only when is true. It allows the server to use an existing document as a template for interactive features.

member.name: P:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.CreateDocumentArgs.ActionID
member.summary: Determines the server interactivity action that should be triggered over an existing document in order to generate the new document.
member.remarks: Applicable only when BaseDocumentID is provided.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportFileResolver
member.summary: Creates an instance from relative path to .trdx file
member.remarks: This class is obsolete. Use instead. It is used to resolve report definitions stored as files on disk.

member.returns: The resulting or null if the path is invalid.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase
member.summary: Base Web API controller for exposing the Telerik Reporting REST Service in an ASP.NET Core application. Provides core configuration, dependency injection, and extensibility points for report processing, caching, and storage. To set up the Reporting REST Service using controllers, add controllers to the application, inherit from this class, add an instance to the dependency container, and ensure the application's endpoints are configured for API controllers. This method for setting up the Reporting REST Service is not compatible with the Telerik Reporting Minimal API approach.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.ExecuteInteractiveAction(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Executes a server-side interactive action on a report document instance for a specific client session.
member.param: The unique identifier for the client session containing the document.
The identifier of the report instance associated with the document.
The unique identifier of the affected report document.
The identifier of the interactive action to execute (e.g., drill-through, sort, toggle).
member.returns: None. Sets the HTTP response status to OK if the action is executed successfully.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically called by the client to trigger interactive features in a rendered report, such as drill-down, sorting, or toggling visibility. The method delegates the actual business logic to . If the action is successful, the HTTP response status is set to 200 OK.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.CreateAIThread(System.String,System.String,Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ClientReportSource)
member.summary: Creates a new AI thread for the specified client session and report instance, based on the rendered document.
member.param: The clientID of the session the AI thread is started in
The report instance used for the AI thread
The report source used by the client (viewer). May be used by end-users for more control over AI functionality per specific report (custom prompts, consent, etc.).
member.returns: An containing the result of the AI thread creation, including thread information or error details.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically called by clients to enable AI-powered features (such as natural language queries or insights) for a specific report instance.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.UpdateAIPrompts(Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ClientReportSource,Telerik.Reporting.Services.Engine.AIThreadInfo)
member.summary: Updates the predefined AI prompts for a given report source and AI thread.
member.param: The report source containing the report definition and parameters.
The AI thread information to update with predefined prompts.
member.remarks: This method is intended for internal use and can be overridden to customize prompt update logic.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.GetAIResponse(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Telerik.Reporting.Services.Engine.AIQueryArgs)
member.summary: Returns a response from the AI model using the prompt passed in the method arguments.
member.param: The clientID of the session the AI thread is started in.
The ID of the report instance used for the AI thread.
The ID of the document used to generate the context metadata for the AI model.
The ID of the AI thread the query relates to.
The arguments used to perform the query.
member.returns: An containing the AI model's response or error details.
member.remarks: contains the prompt and optional parameters that may be used for granular control over the AI model response.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.RegisterClient
member.summary: Registers a new HTTP service client and returns its session information.
member.returns: An containing the client registration result, including client ID and session details.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically called by client applications to initiate a new session with the reporting service.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.UnregisterClient(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an existing client of the HTTP service by its ID and clears all cached data for that client.
member.param: The ID of the client to be removed.
member.remarks: All cached data for the client will be cleared. This is typically called when a client logs out or disconnects.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.KeepClientAlive(System.String)
member.summary: Keeps the client session alive, extending it by the configured session timeout.
member.param: The ID of the client to be kept alive.
member.returns: No content (204) if successful, or a bad request (400) if the client has expired.
member.remarks: This endpoint should be called periodically by clients to prevent session expiration.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.GetClientsSessionTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Gets the client session timeout value in seconds as configured in the service.
member.returns: An containing the client session timeout in seconds.
member.remarks: This value determines how long a client session remains active without keep-alive requests.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.GetConfiguration
member.summary: Gets the backend configuration settings for the reporting service.
member.returns: A containing the instance with configuration details.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically used by client applications to retrieve service configuration, such as available features, limits, or environment settings. It is accessible without authentication.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.#ctor(Telerik.Reporting.Services.IReportServiceConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified report service configuration.
member.param: The report service configuration instance used to configure the reporting service.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.GetBasePath
member.summary: Gets the base path for document resources, such as images.
member.returns: The base path as a string.
member.remarks: This method can be overridden to provide a custom base path resolution strategy for resource files.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.CreateReportResolver
member.summary: Creates an implementation instance for report resolving.
member.remarks: Override this method to create a custom report resolver instance. May be one of the built-in report resolvers or a custom implementation. Built-in resolvers may be chained.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.CreateCache
member.summary: Creates an implementation instance for internal storage.
member.remarks: Override this method to create a custom cache instance. May be one of the built-in caching implementations or a custom implementation. To use a built-in implementation, use the class.
member.returns: An instance of cache to be used by the controller for preserving cache/state.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.CreateStorage
member.summary: Creates an implementation instance for internal storage.
member.remarks: Override this method to create a custom storage instance. May be one of the built-in storage implementations or a custom implementation.
member.returns: An instance of storage to be used by the controller for preserving cache/state.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.CreateReportingEngineConfiguration
member.summary: Creates an instance for configuring the reporting engine.
member.remarks: Override this method to provide a custom configuration instance for the reporting engine.
member.returns: An instance of to be passed to the reporting engine before processing reports.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.CreateDocument(System.String,System.String,Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.CreateDocumentArgs)
member.summary: Creates a new report document using the specified format and settings.
member.param: The client session ID in which the document is created.
The report instance used for the document.
Arguments containing the document format, device info, and additional settings.
member.returns: An containing the result of the document creation, including document ID and status.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically called by clients to generate a new report document in a specific format (e.g., PDF, Excel).

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.ProcessDocumentId(System.String)
member.summary: Called after a document is created to perform additional processing on the document ID.
member.param: The ID of the newly created document.
member.remarks: This method can be overridden in derived controllers to implement custom logic after document creation.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.DeleteDocument(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a report document by its ID.
member.param: The client session ID containing the document to delete.
The report instance used for the document.
The ID of the document to delete.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically called by clients to remove a generated report document and free associated resources.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.GetDocumentInfo(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets metadata and status information for a requested report document.
member.param: The client session ID containing the document.
The report instance used for the document.
The ID of the document.
member.returns: An containing document info such as status, format, and creation time.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.GetDocument(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the content of a report document for single-stream document formats (e.g., PDF, Excel).
member.param: The client session ID containing the document.
The report instance used for the document.
The ID of the document.
member.returns: An containing the document file stream or download response.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically used to download or view the generated report document. The response can be either inline or as an attachment, depending on the query parameter 'response-content-disposition'. If 'inline' is specified, the document is displayed in the browser; otherwise, it is downloaded as an attachment with the appropriate file name and extension.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.GetUserIdentity
member.summary: Override this method to substitute the default retrieval logic, which uses Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ControllerBase.User.Identity.
member.returns: The object instance, that can be later retrieved by property or by using expression =UserIdentity.
member.remarks: This method can be overridden to provide custom user identity resolution logic for authentication and authorization scenarios. The default implementation extracts authentication type, status, and name from the current user principal.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.GetDocumentFormats
member.summary: Gets the available document formats supported by the reporting service.
member.returns: A containing a list of supported document formats (e.g., PDF, XLSX, HTML5).
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically used by clients to determine which export formats are available for report rendering. The returned list may depend on the server configuration and installed extensions.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.CreateInstance(System.String,Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ClientReportSource)
member.summary: Creates a new report instance in a client session.
member.param: The client session ID for which the instance is created.
The report source which defines the report instance.
member.returns: An containing the result of the instance creation, including instance ID and status.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically called by clients to initialize a new report instance for further document generation or parameterization.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.DeleteInstance(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a report instance in a client session.
member.param: The client session ID for which the instance is deleted.
The instance ID that is deleted.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically called by clients to remove a report instance and free associated resources.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ReportsControllerBase.GetPageSettings(System.String,Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ClientReportSource)
member.summary: Gets the report page settings for a specific client and report source.
member.param: The client session ID which contains the document.
The report source which defines the report instance.
member.returns: An containing the page settings (such as size, orientation, and margins) for the specified report.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically used by clients to retrieve page layout information for rendering or printing reports.

The ID of the document.
The number of the requested page (1-based).

The report instance used for the document.
The ID of the document.
The ID of the requested resource.

The report instance used for the document.
The ID of the document to search within.
The arguments used to perform the search, including search token, case sensitivity, and other options.

member.name: T:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ServiceCollectionExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for registering and configuring Telerik Reporting services in an ASP.NET Core application.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddTelerikReporting(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IMvcBuilder)
member.summary:
Registers the Telerik Reporting REST Service with default configuration using the application's domain path and name.
This extension method is used to set up Telerik Reporting REST Service with the minimal API configuration. To use this method, the Reporting middleware should be registered using the or extension method, and the routing middleware should be added to the application pipeline. The minimal API method for setting up the Reporting REST Service is not compatible with the controller-based approach.
member.param: The MVC builder to extend.
member.returns: The MVC builder for chaining.

member.name: M:Telerik.Reporting.Services.AspNetCore.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddTelerikReporting(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IMvcBuilder,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Registers Telerik Reporting with a specified host application ID and reports path.
This extension method is used to set up Telerik Reporting REST Service with the minimal API configuration. To use this method, the Reporting middleware should be registered using the or extension method, and the routing middleware should be added to the application pipeline. The minimal API method for setting up the Reporting REST Service is not compatible with the controller-based approach.
member.param: The MVC builder to extend.
The host application identifier.
The path to the reports directory.
member.returns: The MVC builder for chaining.

member.param: The MVC builder to extend.
The host application identifier.
The storage implementation for caching and document storage.
The reporting engine configuration.
The report source resolver.
member.returns: The MVC builder for chaining.

member.summary:
Registers Telerik Reporting with advanced configuration options.
This extension method is used to set up Telerik Reporting REST Service with the minimal API configuration. To use this method, the Reporting middleware should be registered using the or extension method, and the routing middleware should be added to the application pipeline. The minimal API method for setting up the Reporting REST Service is not compatible with the controller-based approach.
member.param: The MVC builder to extend.
The host application identifier.
The storage implementation for caching and document storage.
The reporting engine configuration.
The report source resolver.
The factory for creating AI client instances.
The report document resolver.
The cache compressor implementation (optional).
The verbosity level for exception messages (optional).
The client session timeout in seconds (optional).
The report sharing timeout in seconds (optional).
The number of worker threads (optional).
The mail context for sending emails (optional).
member.returns: The MVC builder for chaining.

member.summary:
Registers the Telerik Reporting middleware with the default endpoint prefix.
This extension method is used to set up Telerik Reporting REST Service with the minimal API configuration. To use this method, the Reporting REST Service should be registered using the extension method or one of its other overloads, and the routing middleware should be added to the application pipeline. The minimal API method for setting up the Reporting REST Service is not compatible with the controller-based approach.
member.param: The application builder to extend.
member.returns: The application builder for chaining.
